authors.name: Matthew Alhonte
authors.bio: Super villain in somebody's action hero movie. Experienced a radioactive freak accident at a young age, which rendered him part-snake and strangely adept at Python.

ghostPost.plaintext:
https://www.quantamagazine.org/machine-learnings-amazing-ability-to-predict-chaos-20180418/ 
 These are a few of my faaaavorite things

https://medium.com/@NetflixTechBlog/titus-the-netflix-container-management-platform-is-now-open-source-f868c9fb5436

https://research.googleblog.com/2018/04/introducing-semantic-experiences-with.html 
 Cautiously optimistic!  Lotsa stuff has promised to do this and
not-quite-done-it, but hey, nothing happens until it does.

https://medium.com/activewizards-machine-learning-company/a-comparative-analysis-of-chatbots-apis-f9d240263e1d 
 Kinda kooky how mature this tech is getting

https://medium.com/scribd-data-science-engineering/multi-armed-bandits-for-the-win-240b71bc3464 
  Ah, multi-armed bandits.  The old "explore vs exploit" tradeoff.  Or as I like
to call it, "I wish I spent more time reading through that Distributed Systems
book instead of browsing Reddit, but then again I found that book on Reddit to
begin with."
ghostPost.html:
https://www.quantamagazine.org/machine-learnings-amazing-ability-to-predict-chaos-20180418/ These are a few of my faaaavorite things

https://medium.com/@NetflixTechBlog/titus-the-netflix-container-management-platform-is-now-open-source-f868c9fb5436

https://research.googleblog.com/2018/04/introducing-semantic-experiences-with.html Cautiously optimistic!  Lotsa stuff has promised to do this and not-quite-done-it, but hey, nothing happens until it does.

https://medium.com/activewizards-machine-learning-company/a-comparative-analysis-of-chatbots-apis-f9d240263e1d Kinda kooky how mature this tech is getting

https://medium.com/scribd-data-science-engineering/multi-armed-bandits-for-the-win-240b71bc3464  Ah, multi-armed bandits.  The old "explore vs exploit" tradeoff.  Or as I like to call it, "I wish I spent more time reading through that Distributed Systems book instead of browsing Reddit, but then again I found that book on Reddit to begin with."
